all recipes.name: Turkey Chili
all recipes.description: A delicious dish for game nights, ready in an hour.
ingredients: 2 1/4 cups diced tomatoes and green chilies
3 1/2 cups black beans with olive oil, onion and garlic
instructions: Chop vegetables.
Sauté onion with olive oil in a pot until fragrant.
Add ground turkey and cook until color turns white while stirring.
Gradually add vegetables, tomato paste, seasonings, and water (as needed to achieve desired consistency).
Simmer for 30 minutes over low heat.

all recipes.name: Salmon Spring Rolls
all recipes.description: Vietnamese-style, low-calorie dish with a light taste.
instructions: Mix teriyaki sauce, soy sauce and ginger. Slice salmon into even strips or cubes then marinade in fridge for 30 minutes. Cook in a lightly greased skillet over high heat for 3 minutes per side.
Cook noodles according to package. Wash and slice vegetables.
Dip rice paper in warm water for 10 to 15 seconds, remove and lay each side on paper towels to blot dry.
Layer rice noodles, vegetables, and salmon on top of each rice paper. Fold and roll.
Put on a plate then serve with desired sauce.

all recipes.name: Fettuccine Alfredo with Veggies
all recipes.description: Creamy and savory dish with low cholesterol content.
ingredients: 3/4 tsp garlic and herb seasoning blend
1/4 cup roasted garlic parmesan alfredo sauce
instructions: Cook pasta according to package.
Heat oil in a pan. Add onion and pepper blend, and sprinkle with garlic and herb seasoning blend.
Add alfredo sauce and tomatoes. Simmer for a minute.
Add spinach and put lid on for 30 seconds. Stir.
Add cooked pasta and sprinkle with parmesan, then serve.

all recipes.name: Chicken Patties
all recipes.description: Tasty, cholesterol-free dish for lunch or dinner.
instructions: Chop vegetables and mince chicken using a food processor.
Mix all ingredients in a bowl.
Form slightly flat patties and place on a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Put in preheated oven and cook for 20 minutes at 370°F or until golden brown.

all recipes.name: Scrambled Eggs
all recipes.description: A quick and delicious breakfast recipe.
instructions: Mix eggs, shredded cheese, and whipping cream. Season to taste.
Melt butter in a skillet and pour egg mixture.
Cook until firm and ready.

all recipes.name: Mushroom Spinach Omelette
all recipes.description: A healthy, low-calorie breakfast in less than 30 minutes.
instructions: Beat  the eggs and egg whites in a bowl. Season as desired.
Sauté mushrooms in a non-stick skillet over medium heat for a minute before adding spinach.
Pour the egg mixture and cook until firm.

all recipes.name: Bagels with Cranberry
ingredients: 1 tsp baking powder (sodium aluminum sulfate, double acting)
instructions: Mix the dry ingredients then add yogurt and cranberries.
Form into equal-sized bagels and place on a baking sheet.
Bake in preheated oven at 350°F for 25 minutes.

all recipes.name: Hash Brown and Sausage Burrito
all recipes.description: A satisfying, low-sugar dish for breakfast or lunch.
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and fry the hash browns.
Add sausage and egg. Cook until done.
Arrange on tortilla then add shredded cheese.
Roll and wrap. Serve.
